item.title: Seafile accepts bitcoin after Paypal shenanigans
item.description:
Seafile accepts bitcoin after Paypal shenanigans

The open source cloud storage firm, Seafile, has dropped their primary payment processor, Paypal, and started using bitcoin as their preferred payment option. Seafile is a high-performance, fully-encrypted, open source file storage and syncing solution. The service competes directly with Dropbox and other major cloud service providers.

item.title: QueenAnt Exploit Lets Hackers Change The Antminer Bitcoin Payout Address
item.description:
QueenAnt Exploit Lets Hackers Change The Antminer Bitcoin Payout Address

Antminer is one of the most popular Bitcoin hardware manufacturers in the world. The company has built up a solid reputation through their line of Antminer devices, and customers have shown their support for the company throughout the years.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Finally Some Intraday Volatility? - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Finally Some Intraday Volatility? - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this morning. It's taken us a little longer than expected, but we've finally got some decent momentum in the bitcoin price. In yesterday's analysis we highlighted the fact that - despite the fundamentals suggesting we might see some action - price had stayed relatively flat across the last week or so.

item.title: Bitcoin Revolution Hits "The Lonely Planet"
item.description:
Bitcoin Revolution Hits "The Lonely Planet"

Bitcoin awareness grows in Sardinia, Italy, the island otherwise called 'The Lonely Planet.' Associazione Bitcoin Sardegna is engaged in the promotion and advancement of Bitcoin and Blockchain technology through advocacy, education and support for adoption.

item.title: 5 Ways To Buy Weed With Bitcoin
item.description:
5 Ways To Buy Weed With Bitcoin

Cannabis and Bitcoin have a complicated relationship. Participants in either industry often publicly avoid the other due to the stigmas attached to each. They figure partaking in one stigmatized industry is enough. Despite the tenuous relationship, there are plenty of intersections between the digital currency, founded in 2008 by the pseudonymous creator who went by Satoshi Nakamoto before his disappearance, and the cannabis industry.

item.title: Bearish Trading Ahead? Bitcoin Price Sees New Technical Patterns
item.description:
Bearish Trading Ahead? Bitcoin Price Sees New Technical Patterns

Technical indicators suggest that the bitcoin price could be preparing for a rather significant correction, potentially sending it below $600. Traders shouldn't have too much to fear though, as the decline is expected to be followed by bullish activity, resulting in a rise to $700 and beyond, hitting resistance at $1000.

item.title: Altcoin users Can Pay Any BitPay Merchant Through Shapeshift.io
item.description:
Altcoin users Can Pay Any BitPay Merchant Through Shapeshift.io

The main reason why BitPay is promoting this solution is due to the instant conversion process offered by Shapeshift. Rolling out new and innovative features in the world of Bitcoin payments is an absolute must. Cryptocurrency enthusiasts can now pay BitPay invoices by using the Shapeshift.io platform.

item.title: What If Pokémon Go Integrated Bitcoin? - Bitcoin News
item.description:
What If Pokémon Go Integrated Bitcoin? - Bitcoin News

What if someone implemented Bitcoin to the popular Also read: SaruTobi, the Game That Tips Players in Bitcoin, Is Now On Android Pokémon Go app bringing a whole new gamified experience to the augmented world of catching creatures online backed by tokens?

item.title: Altcoins Price Analysis (Week of July 12th): Ethereum, Litecoin and DASH
item.description:
Altcoins Price Analysis (Week of July 12th): Ethereum, Litecoin and DASH

The reason for a weak, flat-like movement on altcoin markets is the undergoing correction of a larger scale. After a large rebound ends, a trend of a similarly large scale usually follows. As was expected, Ethereum's price went into a rebound toward the downward movement.

item.title: US Department of Homeland Security to use the Blockchain | HolyTransaction
item.description:
US Department of Homeland Security to use the Blockchain | HolyTransaction

The US department of Homeland Security (DHS) - the division created after the 9/11 terrorist attacks - talks about the possibility to use the blockchain technology. First announced in a press release published in December, the DHS announced in June that it awarded a prize of $199,000 to the blockchain startup Factom that aims at using the distributed ledger to ensure the security of cameras that monitor US borders.
